author: Pavan Dahat
text:
Chhattisgarh State Congress president Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday alleged that “gunmen were roaming” in the capital Raipur after the “leaked tapes” saga, claiming that his life was under threat. He said the whistleblower responsible for leaking the tapes, Mr.Firoz Siddiqui, too was facing threats.

Addressing a press conference here, Mr. Baghel said, “From the day the leaked tapes were made public, my security has been enhanced. It suggests that even the State government accepts that there is a threat to my life. We also hear these days that some gunmen are roaming in Raipur”.

Mr. Baghel was central to the expulsion of senior Congress leader Ajit Jogi’s son Amit Jogi from the party. He has also been pushing for senior Jogi’s removal from the party.

He also alleged that “talks of a plan” to assassinate a senior Congress leader from Delhi in a ‘Jiram Ghati-type attack’ were going on.

Bhupesh Baghel claims whistleblower in “leaked tape” saga also faced threat
title: Chhattisgarh Congress chief alleges threat to life
